author: Occupational Therapy (OT) and Me
text:
Driving and Community Mobility

Driving is essential for many adults as it enables autonomy and independence. Occupational therapists often work with clients to enable them to drive and maintain their independence in the community.

author: Occupational Therapy (OT) and Me
text:
Growing Older in Your Home

#OccupationalTherapists (OTs) play an essential role for ageing adults. An OT's role is to assess and understand the physical, social and environmental demands placed on an individual in the context of their home. 
 #ot #therapy https://t.co/a1mQduEtEs

text:
13 Considerations for Ergonomics

1. Seat height: The chair should evenly support a person’s thighs with feet flat on the floor.
2. Seat weight: The seat should be at least two inches wider than the person’s thighs

author: Occupational Therapy (OT) and Me
text:
Range of Motion (ROM) Assessment

ROM is the measurement of movement around a specific joint. ROM is often called flexibility and involves the ligaments, tendons, muscles and bones around a particular joint. Do you know how to complete an ROM assessment? https://t.co/GfnX9K3bdq

author: Occupational Therapy (OT) and Me
text:
Leukemia and #OT

Leukemia is a type of cancer that affects the blood. In people with leukemia, the body produces abnormal white blood cells that don’t function properly. Learn how #OccupationalTherapy can help here: https://t.co/VzMXpodr13
#ot #ota #therapy

author: Occupational Therapy (OT) and Me
text:
Newborn Baby Reflexes

Healthcare providers, such as pediatric occupational therapists, may use reflexes to determine if a baby’s brain and nervous system function normally. Learn more here: https://t.co/8gWBLW6leQ

#occupationaltherapy #occupationaltherapist #ot #ota #therapy

author: Occupational Therapy (OT) and Me
text:
Osteomyelitis

Osteomyelitis is an infection in the bone caused by bacteria. Common signs and symptoms of osteomyelitis include pain, swelling, redness, fever, and difficulty moving joints surrounding the affected area. More info here: https://t.co/n7VS0hdk1r
 #ot #ota #therapy

author: Occupational Therapy (OT) and Me
text:

As healthcare professionals, therapists can learn how to adapt and transform practice standards to be responsive to the needs of intersecting marginalized populations. Want to know how? Click here: https://t.co/b1PyvrQ97s https://t.co/otNzgm1c1m

text:

Appropriately managing medications can be more challenging for some people if living with physical or cognitive impairments. #OccupationalTherapists can help people manage their medications: https://t.co/a927XhGR83
 #ot #ota #therapy

author: Occupational Therapy (OT) and Me
text:
Pathways and Resources for Engagement and Participation (PREP)

PREP intervention protocol is an evidence-based intervention that enhances participation by modifying the environment. Learn more about PREP and how to use it here: https://t.co/1dFRx6HVNV
 #ot #ota #therapy #rehab

author: Occupational Therapy (OT) and Me
text:
Pressure Ulcers

Pressure ulcers are referred to as bed sores because they often form after sitting or lying in one position for long periods. People on chronic bed rest or consistently sitting in a wheelchair are at risk of developing pressure ulcers. https://t.co/4MqMgKRO9H

author: Occupational Therapy (OT) and Me
text:
Geriatrics and #OccupationalTherapy

Gerontology is the study of health and disease in the later stages of life. Occupational therapists who work with geriatric populations should understand the ageing process and its impact on behaviours. More info: https://t.co/x3PB5fNqG1

author: Occupational Therapy (OT) and Me
text:
Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)

COPD is a group of lung diseases where the lungs' airways become swollen and partially blocked, making it difficult to breathe. Learn more about COPD and how #OccupationalTherapists can help: https://t.co/GglMx1rGHH

author: Occupational Therapy (OT) and Me
text:
Muscular Dystrophy

Muscular dystrophy refers to a group of diseases that leads to progressive weakening and loss of muscle function. There are many different types of muscular dystrophy, and each has different effects. Learn more here:https://t.co/S96X0fQ74p
